message:
Merge pull request #10334 from MicrosoftDocs/main

Auto Publish – main to live - 2025-11-06 23:06 UTC

    "blob_url": "https://github.com/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs/blob/38d12bb5b5a7387ec63266f1c941068914e67b40/docs%2Fexternal-id%2Fcustomers%2Fhow-to-create-external-tenant-portal.md",
    "raw_url": "https://github.com/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs/raw/38d12bb5b5a7387ec63266f1c941068914e67b40/docs%2Fexternal-id%2Fcustomers%2Fhow-to-create-external-tenant-portal.md",
    "contents_url": "https://api.github.com/repos/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs/contents/docs%2Fexternal-id%2Fcustomers%2Fhow-to-create-external-tenant-portal.md?ref=38d12bb5b5a7387ec63266f1c941068914e67b40",
    "patch": "@@ -6,7 +6,7 @@ manager: dougeby\n ms.service: entra-external-id\n ms.subservice: external\n ms.topic: how-to\n-ms.date: 05/21/2025\n+ms.date: 11/06/2025\n ms.author: cmulligan\n ms.custom: it-pro, seo-july-2024, sfi-image-nochange\n #Customer intent: As an it admin, I want to learn how to create an external tenant in the  Microsoft Entra admin center. \n@@ -53,7 +53,11 @@ In this article, you learn how to:\n \n     - Type your desired **Domain Name** (for example *Contosocustomers*).\n \n-    - Select your desired **Location**. This selection can't be changed later.\n+1. Select your desired **Country/Region**. This selection can't be changed later.\n+\n+    If you select a country/region that supports the Go-Local add-on, such as Australia or Japan, a **Go-Local data residency** option appears. You can elect to have your Microsoft Entra ID Core Store data and Microsoft Entra ID components and service data stored in the selected location. For more information, see [Go-Local add-on](../../fundamentals/data-residency.md#go-local-add-on).\n+\n+    :::image type=\"content\" source=\"media/how-to-create-external-tenant-portal/go-local-add-on-option.png\" alt-text=\"Screenshot of the Basics tab and the Go-Local data residency option.\":::\n \n 1. Select **Next: Add a subscription**.  \n "
  },

    "raw_url": "https://github.com/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs/raw/38d12bb5b5a7387ec63266f1c941068914e67b40/docs%2Fexternal-id%2Fcustomers%2Ftoc.yml",
    "contents_url": "https://api.github.com/repos/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs/contents/docs%2Fexternal-id%2Fcustomers%2Ftoc.yml?ref=38d12bb5b5a7387ec63266f1c941068914e67b40",
    "patch": "@@ -300,6 +300,8 @@ items:\n       href: concept-planning-your-solution.md\n     - name: Woodgrove demo overview\n       href: overview-solutions-customers.md\n+    - name: Data residency\n+      href: ../../fundamentals/data-residency.md?toc=/entra/external-id/toc.json&bc=/entra/external-id/breadcrumb/toc.json\n     - name: Security settings\n       href: concept-security-customers.md\n     - name: User profile attributes"
  },
  {
    "sha": "c3da60597efb37f235e796d42f8c8fe5b649c566",
    "filename": "docs/fundamentals/data-residency.md",
    "status": "modified",
    "additions": 25,
    "deletions": 14,
    "changes": 39,
    "blob_url": "https://github.com/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs/blob/38d12bb5b5a7387ec63266f1c941068914e67b40/docs%2Ffundamentals%2Fdata-residency.md",
    "raw_url": "https://github.com/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs/raw/38d12bb5b5a7387ec63266f1c941068914e67b40/docs%2Ffundamentals%2Fdata-residency.md",
    "contents_url": "https://api.github.com/repos/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs/contents/docs%2Ffundamentals%2Fdata-residency.md?ref=38d12bb5b5a7387ec63266f1c941068914e67b40",
    "patch": "@@ -6,10 +6,10 @@ manager: martinco\n ms.service: entra\n ms.subservice: fundamentals\n ms.topic: concept-article\n-ms.date: 08/25/2024\n+ms.date: 11/06/2025\n ms.author: jricketts\n ms.reviewer: jricketts\n-ms.custom: \"it-pro\"\n+ms.custom: it-pro, references_regions\n ms.collection:\n # Customer intent: As a cloud administrator, I want to understand how Microsoft Entra ID handles data residency, so that I can ensure compliance with data residency requirements and make informed decisions about storing and managing identity and access data in the cloud.\n ---\n@@ -19,7 +19,7 @@ ms.collection:\n Microsoft Entra ID is an Identity as a Service (IDaaS) solution that stores and manages identity and access data in the cloud. You can use the data to enable and manage access to cloud services, achieve mobility scenarios, and secure your organization. An instance of the Microsoft Entra ID service, called a [tenant](~/identity-platform/developer-glossary.md#tenant), is an isolated set of directory object data that the customer provisions and owns.\n \n > [!NOTE]\n-> Microsoft Entra External ID is a customer identity and access management (CIAM) solution that stores and manages data in a separate tenant created for your customer-facing apps and customer directory data. This tenant is called the external tenant. When you create an external tenant, you have the option to select the geographic location (shown as \"Country/Region\" in the admin portal) for data storage. It’s important to note that the data locations and region availability may differ from those of Microsoft Entra ID, as indicated in this article.\n+> Microsoft Entra External ID is a customer identity and access management (CIAM) solution with the option and flexibility to store and manage data in a separate tenant created for your customer-facing apps and customer directory data. This tenant is called an external tenant. When you create an external tenant, you have the option to select the geographic location (shown as \"Country/Region\" in the admin portal) for data storage. It’s important to note that the data locations and region availability may differ from those of Microsoft Entra ID, as indicated in this article.\n \n ## Core Store\n \n@@ -30,25 +30,25 @@ For more information on the Core Store, see [Microsoft Entra Core Store Scale Un\n Microsoft Entra ID is available in the following clouds:\n \n - Public\n-- China*\n-- US government*\n+- China (2)\n+- US government (2)\n \n-*\\* Not currently available for external tenants.*\n+*(2) Not currently available for external tenants.*\n \n In the public cloud, you're prompted to select a location (shown as \"Country/Region\" in the admin portal) at the time of tenant creation (for example, signing up for Office 365 or Azure, or creating more Microsoft Entra instances through the Azure portal). Microsoft Entra ID maps the selection to a geo-location and a single scale unit in it. Tenant location can't be changed after it's set.\n \n The location selected during tenant creation will map to one of the following geo-locations:\n \n-- Australia*\n+- Australia (1)\n - Asia/Pacific\n - Europe, Middle East, and Africa (EMEA)\n-- Japan*\n+- Japan (1)\n - North America\n - Worldwide\n  \n-*\\* Not currently available for external tenants.*\n+*(1) Available for external tenants with the [Go-Local add-on](#go-local-add-on).*\n \n-Microsoft Entra ID handles Core Store data based on usability, performance, residency or other requirements based on geo-location. Microsoft Entra ID replicates each tenant through its scale unit, across datacenters, based on the following criteria:\n+Microsoft Entra ID handles Core Store data based on usability, performance, residency, or other requirements based on geo-location. Microsoft Entra ID replicates each tenant through its scale unit, across datacenters, based on the following criteria:\n \n - Microsoft Entra Core Store data, stored in datacenters closest to the tenant-residency location, to reduce latency and provide fast user sign-in times\n - Microsoft Entra Core Store data stored in geographically isolated datacenters to assure availability during unforeseen single-datacenter, catastrophic events\n@@ -64,12 +64,13 @@ Use the following table to see Microsoft Entra cloud solution models based on in\n |---|---|---|---|---|\n |Public geo located|Australia (1), North America, EMEA, Japan (1), Asia/Pacific|At rest, in the target location. Exceptions by component service or feature, listed in the next section|Operated by Microsoft. Microsoft datacenter personnel must pass a background check.|Create the tenant in the sign-up experience. Choose the location for data residency.|\n |Public worldwide|Worldwide|All locations|Operated by Microsoft. Microsoft datacenter personnel must pass a background check.|Tenant creation available via official support channel and subject to Microsoft discretion.|\n-|Sovereign or national clouds|US government (1), China (1)|At rest, in the target location. No exceptions.|Operated by a data custodian (2). Personnel are screened according to requirements.|Each national cloud instance has a sign-up experience.|\n+|Sovereign or national clouds|US government (2), China (2)|At rest, in the target location. No exceptions.|Operated by a data custodian (3). Personnel are screened according to requirements.|Each national cloud instance has a sign-up experience.|\n \n **Table references**:\n \n-(1) These locations aren't currently available for external tenants.\n-(2) **Data custodians**: datacenters in the US government cloud are operated by Microsoft. In China, Microsoft Entra ID is operated through a partnership with [21Vianet](/microsoft-365/admin/services-in-china/services-in-china?redirectSourcePath=%252fen-us%252farticle%252fLearn-about-Office-365-operated-by-21Vianet-a8ab5061-3346-4da0-bb7c-5260822b53ae&view=o365-21vianet&viewFallbackFrom=o365-worldwide&preserve-view=true).\n+- (1) These locations are available for external tenants with the [Go-Local add-on](#go-local-add-on).\n+- (2) These locations aren't currently available for external tenants.\n+- (3) **Data custodians**: datacenters in the US government cloud are operated by Microsoft. In China, Microsoft Entra ID is operated through a partnership with [21Vianet](/microsoft-365/admin/services-in-china/services-in-china?redirectSourcePath=%252fen-us%252farticle%252fLearn-about-Office-365-operated-by-21Vianet-a8ab5061-3346-4da0-bb7c-5260822b53ae&view=o365-21vianet&viewFallbackFrom=o365-worldwide&preserve-view=true).\n \n Learn more:\n \n@@ -107,6 +108,17 @@ Learn more: [Microsoft Entra product overview](https://www.microsoft.com/cloud-p\n |Microsoft Entra ID Protection|Microsoft Entra ID Protection uses real-time user log-in data, with multiple signals from company and industry sources, to feed its machine-learning systems that detect anomalous logins. Personal data is scrubbed from real-time log-in data before it's passed to the machine learning system. The remaining log-in data identifies potentially risky usernames and logins. After analysis, the data goes to Microsoft reporting systems. Risky logins and usernames appear in reporting for Administrators.|In geo location|\n |Managed identities for Azure resources| Managed identities for Azure resources with managed identities systems can authenticate to Azure services, without storing credentials. Rather than use username and password, managed identities authenticate to Azure services with certificates. The service writes certificates it issues in Azure Cosmos DB in the East US region, which fail over to another region, as needed. Azure Cosmos DB geo-redundancy occurs by global data replication. Database replication puts a read-only copy in each region that Microsoft Entra managed identities runs. To learn more, see [Azure services that can use managed identities to access other services](~/identity/managed-identities-azure-resources/managed-identities-status.md). Microsoft isolates each Azure Cosmos DB instance in a Microsoft Entra cloud solution model. </br> The resource provider, such as the virtual machine (VM) host, stores the certificate for authentication, and identity flows, with other Azure services. The service stores its master key to access Azure Cosmos DB in a datacenter secrets management service. Azure Key Vault stores the master encryption keys.|In geo location|\n \n+## Go-Local add-on\n+\n+The Go-Local add-on is a feature in Microsoft Entra External ID that enables certain customers to configure some services to store their data at rest in a selected geographic location, such as a country or region. This capability is a way of fulfilling corporate policies and compliance requirements. You select the country or region for data storage when you [create an external tenant](../external-id/customers/how-to-create-external-tenant-portal.md).\n+\n+The Go-Local add-on is a paid add-on, but it's optional. If you choose to use it, you'll incur an extra charge in addition to your Microsoft Entra External ID Basic. For more information, see [Microsoft Entra External ID pricing](https://www.microsoft.com/en-us/security/pricing/microsoft-entra-external-id/).\n+\n+The following countries/regions currently have the local data residence option:\n+\n+- Australia\n+- Japan\n+\n ## Related resources\n \n For more information on data residency in Microsoft Cloud offerings, see the following articles:\n@@ -118,6 +130,5 @@ For more information on data residency in Microsoft Cloud offerings, see the fol\n \n ## Next steps\n \n-- [Microsoft Entra ID and data residency](data-residency.md) (You're here)\n - [Data operational considerations](data-operational-considerations.md)\n - [Data protection considerations](data-protection-considerations.md)"
  },

    "sha": "bfea7201b5474c774dae32e937a505c89f4cd07b",
    "filename": "docs/id-governance/microsoft-entra-id-governance-licensing-for-guest-users.md",
    "status": "modified",
    "additions": 2,
    "deletions": 3,
    "changes": 5,
    "blob_url": "https://github.com/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs/blob/38d12bb5b5a7387ec63266f1c941068914e67b40/docs%2Fid-governance%2Fmicrosoft-entra-id-governance-licensing-for-guest-users.md",
    "raw_url": "https://github.com/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs/raw/38d12bb5b5a7387ec63266f1c941068914e67b40/docs%2Fid-governance%2Fmicrosoft-entra-id-governance-licensing-for-guest-users.md",
    "contents_url": "https://api.github.com/repos/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs/contents/docs%2Fid-governance%2Fmicrosoft-entra-id-governance-licensing-for-guest-users.md?ref=38d12bb5b5a7387ec63266f1c941068914e67b40",
    "patch": "@@ -162,9 +162,8 @@ To use Microsoft Entra ID Governance features for guest users, your tenant must\n \n - You won't be able to create new access reviews scoped to guest users if any of the following features are selected: \n     - Inactive user access review\n-- User-to-group affiliation recommendation helper\n-    - You won't be able to update existing reviews that add these features.\n-\n+    - User-to-group affiliation recommendation helper\n+    \n ### Entitlement Management\n \n - You won't be able to create policies with guests in scope (“*For all users in your directory including guests*” or “*For users not in your directory*”) and the Microsoft Entra ID Governance features listed in this documentation (For example, sponsor approvers, custom extensions, and Verified ID)."
  },
  {
    "sha": "7852108c797c037271cce3c6b5ade06541a59fe3",
    "filename": "docs/identity/authentication/concept-fido2-compatibility.md",
    "status": "modified",
    "additions": 1,
    "deletions": 10,
    "changes": 11,
    "blob_url": "https://github.com/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs/blob/38d12bb5b5a7387ec63266f1c941068914e67b40/docs%2Fidentity%2Fauthentication%2Fconcept-fido2-compatibility.md",
    "raw_url": "https://github.com/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs/raw/38d12bb5b5a7387ec63266f1c941068914e67b40/docs%2Fidentity%2Fauthentication%2Fconcept-fido2-compatibility.md",
    "contents_url": "https://api.github.com/repos/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs/contents/docs%2Fidentity%2Fauthentication%2Fconcept-fido2-compatibility.md?ref=38d12bb5b5a7387ec63266f1c941068914e67b40",
    "patch": "@@ -5,7 +5,7 @@ description: Web browser and native app support for FIDO2 passwordless authentic\n ms.service: entra-id\n ms.subservice: authentication\n ms.topic: article\n-ms.date: 09/24/2025\n+ms.date: 11/06/2025\n \n author: justinha\n ms.author: justinha\n@@ -47,7 +47,6 @@ The following section covers support for passkey (FIDO2) authentication in web b\n - Sign-in with passkey requires macOS Catalina 11.1 or later with Safari 14 or later because Microsoft Entra ID requires user verification for multifactor authentication.\n - Near-field communication (NFC) and Bluetooth Low Energy (BLE) security keys aren't supported on macOS by Apple.\n - New security key registration doesn't work on these macOS browsers because they don't prompt to set up biometrics or PIN.\n-- See [Sign in when more than three passkeys are registered](#sign-in-when-more-than-three-passkeys-are-registered) for Safari on macOS.\n \n ### ChromeOS\n - NFC and BLE security keys aren't supported on ChromeOS by Google.\n@@ -61,20 +60,12 @@ The following section covers support for passkey (FIDO2) authentication in web b\n - BLE security keys aren't supported on iOS by Apple.\n - NFC with FIPS 140-3 certified security keys isn't supported on iOS by Apple.\n - New security key registration doesn't work on iOS browsers because they don't prompt to set up biometrics or PIN.\n-- See [Sign in when more than three passkeys are registered](#sign-in-when-more-than-three-passkeys-are-registered).\n \n ### Android\n - Sign-in with passkey requires Google Play Services 21 or later because Microsoft Entra ID requires user verification for multifactor authentication.\n - BLE and NFC security keys aren't supported on Android by Google.\n - Sign-in with passkey isn't supported in Firefox on Android.\n \n-## Known issues\n-\n-### Sign in when more than three passkeys are registered\n-\n-If you registered more than three passkeys, sign in with a passkey might not work on iOS or Safari on macOS. If you have more than three passkeys, as a workaround, click **Sign-in options** and sign in without entering a username.\n-\n-:::image type=\"content\" border=\"true\" source=\"media/fido2-compatibility/sign-in-options.png\" alt-text=\"Screenshot of sign-in options.\":::\n \n ## [**Native apps**](#tab/native)\n "
  },
  {
    "sha": "c743c97c3d66f94bdb39fa13e899b81041f6510c",
    "filename": "docs/identity/authentication/how-to-mfa-number-match.md",
    "status": "modified",
    "additions": 41,
    "deletions": 3,
    "changes": 44,
    "blob_url": "https://github.com/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs/blob/38d12bb5b5a7387ec63266f1c941068914e67b40/docs%2Fidentity%2Fauthentication%2Fhow-to-mfa-number-match.md",
    "raw_url": "https://github.com/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs/raw/38d12bb5b5a7387ec63266f1c941068914e67b40/docs%2Fidentity%2Fauthentication%2Fhow-to-mfa-number-match.md",
    "contents_url": "https://api.github.com/repos/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs/contents/docs%2Fidentity%2Fauthentication%2Fhow-to-mfa-number-match.md?ref=38d12bb5b5a7387ec63266f1c941068914e67b40",
    "patch": "@@ -4,7 +4,7 @@ description: Learn how to use number matching in multifactor authentication noti\n ms.service: entra-id\n ms.subservice: authentication\n ms.topic: article\n-ms.date: 03/04/2025\n+ms.date: 11/06/2025\n ms.author: justinha\n author: justinha\n # Customer intent: As an identity administrator, I want to explain how number matching in MFA push notifications from Authenticator in Microsoft Entra ID works in different use cases.\n@@ -97,6 +97,44 @@ In addition:\n \n If your organization uses Remote Desktop Gateway and the user registered for a TOTP code along with Authenticator push notifications, the user can't meet the Microsoft Entra MFA challenge and Remote Desktop Gateway sign-in fails. In this case, set `OVERRIDE_NUMBER_MATCHING_WITH_OTP = FALSE` to fall back to **Approve**/**Deny** push notifications with Authenticator.\n \n+## Authenticator app same-device number matching\n+\n+When a user signs in for MFA or phone sign-in with number match to Microsoft mobile apps like Teams and Outlook on the same device as their Authenticator app, they can reply Yes/No when prompted rather than enter the number. Users who sign in with Microsoft Edge, Chrome, or Safari web browsers continue to enter the number to sign in. \n+\n+This greatly improves the experience for users who sign in with number matching on the same device where they run Authenticator. There's no increased risk for users by switching to Yes/No because the prompt only shows on the device that initiated the sign in. \n+\n+Platform-specific scenario details are provided in this topic.\n+\n+>[!Note] \n+>In the following scenarios, the user signs in on the same device as Authenticator. There's no experience change when users complete number matching on a different device.\n+\n+### How to prepare \n+\n+Administrators don't need to configure anything to prepare. Users only need to run the latest version of Microsoft Authenticator. \n+\n+### [**iOS**](#tab/iOS)\n+\n+#### Changes to the user experience\n+\n+Scenario | Experience change?\n+---------|--------------------------\n+User signs in to Authenticator to upgrade the account they use for multifactor authentication (MFA). | Yes. The user sees a notification with the number match request on the sign-in screen. In Microsoft mobile apps like Authenticator, they can tap the notification and reply Yes/No to complete the sign-in.\n+User signs in to a Microsoft app like Outlook or Teams without a single sign-on (SSO) extension. | Yes. The user sees a notification with the number match request on the sign-in screen. In Microsoft mobile apps like Outlook or Teams, they can tap the notification and reply Yes/No to complete the sign-in.\n+User signs in to a Microsoft app like Outlook or Teams with an SSO extension. | Yes. The user sees the Yes/No prompt but they need to open the Authenticator app to complete the sign-in.\n+User signs in to a browser like Edge or Chrome. | No. The user sees a notification with the number match request on the sign-in screen. In a browser, they need to tap the notification to enter the number and approve the sign-in.\n+\n+### [**Android**](#tab/Android)\n+\n+#### Changes to the user experience when doing same-device number matching\n+\n+Scenario | Experience change?\n+---------|--------------------------\n+User signs in to Authenticator to upgrade the account they use for multifactor authentication (MFA). | Yes. The user sees a notification with the number match request on the sign-in screen. In Microsoft mobile apps like Authenticator, they can tap the notification and reply Yes/No to complete the sign-in.\n+User signs in to a Microsoft app like Outlook or Teams. | Yes. The user sees a notification with the number match request on the sign-in screen. In Microsoft mobile apps like Outlook or Teams, they can tap the notification and reply Yes/No to complete the sign-in.\n+User signs in to a browser like Edge or Chrome. | No. The user sees a notification with the number match request on the sign-in screen. In a browser, they need to tap the notification to enter the number and approve the sign-in. \n+\n+---\n+\n ## FAQs\n \n This section provides answers to common questions.\n@@ -117,9 +155,9 @@ Users who are enabled for MFA push notifications in the legacy MFA policy also s\n \n :::image type=\"content\" border=\"true\" source=\"./media/how-to-mfa-number-match/notifications-through-mobile-app.png\" alt-text=\"Screenshot that shows the setting Notification through mobile app.\":::\n \n-### Is number matching supported with Azure Multi-Factor Authentication Server?\n+### Is number matching supported with Azure Multifactor Authentication Server?\n \n-No, number matching isn't enforced because it's not a supported feature for Azure Multi-Factor Authentication Server, which is [deprecated](https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/microsoft-entra-azure-ad-blog/microsoft-entra-change-announcements-september-2022-train/ba-p/2967454).\n+No, number matching isn't enforced because it's not a supported feature for Azure Multifactor Authentication Server, which is [deprecated](https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/microsoft-entra-azure-ad-blog/microsoft-entra-change-announcements-september-2022-train/ba-p/2967454).\n \n ### What happens if a user runs an older version of Authenticator?\n "
  },
  {
    "sha": "ed1720ec28c2a27b98afdb22dfa8787e6df0d7b8",

    "raw_url": "https://github.com/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs/raw/572a38ac7eb1231f1079ae8bdd97c4ae8f76575e/docs%2Fidentity%2Fauthentication%2Fmedia%2Ffido2-compatibility%2Fsign-in-options.png",
    "contents_url": "https://api.github.com/repos/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs/contents/docs%2Fidentity%2Fauthentication%2Fmedia%2Ffido2-compatibility%2Fsign-in-options.png?ref=572a38ac7eb1231f1079ae8bdd97c4ae8f76575e"
  }
]. Please summarise it in a few sentences, using UK grammar and ensure the response is formatted for markdown. Do not start the response with here is summary.","role":"user"}
ai_summary.Response: The commit introduces the **Go-Local add-on** for Microsoft Entra External ID, allowing customers in Australia and Japan to store their data at rest in a selected geographic location. This update also includes a new **same-device number matching experience** for the Authenticator app on iOS and Android, simplifying MFA sign-ins for users of Microsoft mobile apps. Additionally, documentation has been refined across several areas, including FIDO2 compatibility and Azure Multifactor Authentication Server deprecation.
